answers.answer: Babies have a WONDERFUL chance if born at 32 weeks.  You will be fine.  The numbness could probably be anything.  I am not even pg right now and I still get it in my left hand all the time.  Good luck to you and Take Care
I have the same thing with my pinky finger!  Ever since I had my son.  I have been meaning to call my dr about it.  I have to watch out because diabetes runs in my family.Gina

My sister has had nimbness in her hands for hte past few weeks- she is about 30 weeks now.  Supposedly carpal tunnel syndrome in pregnancy is not uncommon.  My arms go numb when I am sleeping, but are usually okay when I'm up and about.
how is your blood pressure? it could be a circulation thing....

The position of the baby won't effect nerves up as high as your arms and hands, but lots of other things that have to do with pregnancy (swelling, bloodflow, etc.) can. Also, my friend just had a 34 weeker and she spent about 1-1/2 weeks in the hospital for feeding/weight gain and went home just fine. Good luck!

question: I have been experiencing numbness in my pinking and the finger right beside it lately, just on my left hand.  Does this mean the baby is laying on a nerve or some kind of carpal tunnel.  I never had this happen before.  The cramping is still there today but not as bad as yesterday, I thought I was going into labor but a quick trip to the dr and he figures its just where he is laying.  Babies born at 32 weeks have a fairly good chance do they not?
title: numbness in finger
